content.prompt: ​Which of the following is the graph of the polar function r=fθ{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}, where fθ=3cosθ+2{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}, in the polar coordinate system for 0≤θ≤2π{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} ?

choices.label:
• This is a polar curve with one loop that has an indentation at the origin (the center of the polar coordinate system), and the curve extends to the right.
  • The curve moves from the origin, upward and to the right, passing through the radii of 1, 2, and 3, to a maximum distance from the polar axis.
  • From the maximum distance from the polar axis, the curve moves down and to the right until it reaches the radius of 4.
  • The curve has symmetry over the polar axis.

• This is a polar curve with one outer loop and one inner loop.
  • The outer loop has an indentation at the origin (the center of the polar coordinate system), and the curve extends to the right.
  • The outer loop moves from the origin, upward and to the right, passing through the radii of 1, 2, and 3, to a maximum distance from the polar axis.
  • From the maximum distance from the polar axis, the outer loop moves down and to the right until it reaches the radius of 4.
  • The outer loop has symmetry over the polar axis.
  • The inner loop moves from the origin, upward and to the right, passing through the radius of 1, to a maximum distance from the polar axis.
  • From the maximum distance from the polar axis, the inner loop moves down and to the right until it reaches the radius of 2.
  • The inner loop has symmetry over the polar axis.

• This is a polar curve with one loop that has an indentation at the origin (the center of the polar coordinate system), and the curve extends to the right.
  • The curve moves from the origin, upward and to the right, passing through the radii of 1, 2, and 3, to a maximum distance from the polar axis.
  • From the maximum distance from the polar axis, the curve moves down and to the right until it reaches the radius of 5.
  • The curve has symmetry over the polar axis.

• This is a polar curve with one outer loop and one inner loop.
  • The outer loop has an indentation at the origin (the center of the polar coordinate system), and the curve extends to the right.
  • The outer loop moves from the origin, upward and to the right, passing through the radii of 1, 2, and 3, to a maximum distance from the polar axis.
  • From the maximum distance from the polar axis, the outer loop moves down and to the right until it reaches the radius of 5.
  • The outer loop has symmetry over the polar axis.
  • The inner loop moves from the origin, upward and to the right, passing through the radius of 1, to a maximum distance from the polar axis.
  • From the maximum distance from the polar axis, the inner loop moves down and to the right until it reaches the radius of 2.
  • The inner loop has symmetry over the polar axis.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
